data.title: Great course
data.text: We had a large group play the course last year.  It was in great shape.  Got on and off rather quickly.  I played many years ago.  It is much better than the days when Caddy Shack was filmed their (old rolling hills).  Lots of mature trees and a island hole that will challenge every level golfer.  It was very pricey but, I had to play it again and loved it.  Worth a round!

data.title: Golf course needs help
data.text: I played this course a couple of years ago and the they closed it last summer to redo it  Otis in worse shape now after the renovations. The greensonyhe front 9 are horrible  don't bother playing.

data.title: Great golf course
data.text: Course is beautiful. Nice course for women too. The Oak trees make you feel a world apart from Ft.Lauderdale city. Food is also excellent and staff predicts your needs before you even ask.

data.title: A great course without too much water in South Florida
data.text:
I stayed at the Ritz Carlton hotel in Ft. Lauderdale traveling alone on business.  I asked the concierge to recommend a golf course, and he set me up with the Grande Oaks.  It was about a 25 minute drive inland from the hotel.

The course is well gated.  Nobody can enter until the receptionist clears you and opens the imposing gates.  Once inside, valet parking for your car and hand delivery of the clubs.  The clubhouse is very elegant - quite nice.  The pro shop staff is friendly and courteous.  Included in your round is free use of the driving range, which is a short golf cart ride from the pro shop.

The course lays claim to being the location where the much of the movie "Caddie Shack" was filmed.  But don't hold that over them - nor let it push you to expect too much, or too little.  Overall, this is a very nicely laid out course.  It has water, but not insane amounts like can happen in south Florida.  As a 15 handicapper I found the course VERY playable from the member tees, and would greatly enjoy playing it again.  If you are a scratch golfer knock yourself out from the back tees - as the added length will challenge your accuracy.  This is a course that requires skill, not just the ability to hit the long ball.  Better to play your control clubs than try to be a bomber, or you'll have some tough second shots.

The day I visited the high was 50 degrees, so there was almost no one on the course.  I think on warmer days it may well be more crowded.  But, if you can find a way to gain admittance I thoroughly recommend Grande Oaks - it is a good experience and fairly priced.

data.title: Dinner Event was Tops!
data.text: Our church school held a dinner fundraiser at Grande Oaks and it was superb. The food was excellent, the service was top-notch, and the western sunset view through the huge glass windows in the dining area was spectacular. We were hugely impressed! The event was a success, and we're certainly inclined to go back.
